agents.impl.dhcp

Class NetworkableAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • agents.MetaAgent
      • agents.SystemAgent
        • agents.impl.dhcp.NetworkableAgent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DhcpClientAgent, DhcpServerAgent

    public abstract class NetworkableAgent
extends SystemAgent
    An extension of MetaAgent that provides methods and variables for IP and MAC addresses as well as the getters/setters and behaviour to assign a random MAC address on creation of the agent. This agent replaces the name variable with a MAC address on creation and overrides MetaAgent.getName() by returning the most qualified address for the NetworkableAgent.
    See Also:
    getQualifiedAddress(), getName()

      • getQualifiedAddress

        public java.lang.String getQualifiedAddress()
        Returns the most qualified address for the networked agent. Implementing classes can choose which address is more qualifying in the circumstances for itself by overriding this method. By default this method chooses the IP address over the MAC address for then NetworkableAgent, (If IP is null then MAC else IP).
        Returns:
        The most qualified address for the networked agent.

      • assignMac

        protected final void assignMac()
        Assigns a random MAC address for the NetworkableAgent. Creates a 6-byte array for MAC address and creates a String identifier from it in the format of XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX. MAC addresses created via this method are not completely guaranteed to be unique; however, unique occurrences of the same MAC address is unlikely as the seed for the random creation is based from the system's nano-time.

      • canReceive

        protected boolean canReceive(Message message)
        Calls the super version of this method to check if this agent can receive or checks if the qualified address matches the message's recipient.
        Overrides:
        canReceive in class MetaAgent
        Parameters:
        message - The message that we to check if we can receive it.
        Returns:
        True if we can receive the message; false otherwise.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the qualified address of the NetworkableAgent as the name of the agent is unnecessary in the case of MAC and IP based networking.
        Overrides:
        getName in class MetaAgent
        Returns:
        The Qualified address of the NetworkableAgent.
        See Also:
        getQualifiedAddress()
